metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6463 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 81.0.4044.122 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6463` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 19.10, the chromium-browser package is just a script that installs the Chromium snap tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
